intro: Boehmeria virgata var. molliuscula, commonly known as silky boehmeria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the nettle family, Urticaceae, and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves that give it a silken texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its fibrous stems have been historically used for making textiles and paper.
